name: 中級寫作（一）
restrict: ◎限本系(含雙主修)修習◎必須先修過【ENU0237  寫作指導（一）】、【ENU0238  寫作指導（二）】
goals: To help students student develop their ability to express themselves in writing essays in English
To help students write various kinds of essays in a well-organized manner
syllabus:
**The Objectives**: This course is designed to help students **cultivate** **their ability to express themselves** in written English in the form of **five paragraph essays.**

1.  At first, **the basics of essay writing** will be presented in an easy-to-follow progression of lessons and activities by way of **short lectures****, straightforward advice and practical assignments** (in class and for written homework). The major concern at this time will be **free-writing practice and techniques**, in order to develop the students’ writing fluency and to **encourage the creativity and individual style** they will need to approach writing essays with confidence.
2.  Thereafter, the students will begin writing **five paragraph essays** in **several genres** including **descriptive/creative, TOEFL exam writing**, **film criticism** and **argumentative discourse**. By the end of the semester, every student should be able to write a well-organised, focused and logical five-paragraph English essay in a number of genres.
3.  Finally, **autonomous extracurricular writing is** **required**. Students should practice writing at every opportunity and do so in their “Writing Journals”, which will be reviewed and assessed by the lecturer at the end of the semester.

**Guidelines and Requirements:** The Rules

1.  Punctual attendance is required. Please be on time. It’s polite. **Talk to or email me** if you have a problem attending or couldn’t attend class.

1.  **Actively participate** in class discussions and writing activities.
2.  You need to **submit** homework **_several times_** during the semester.
3.  **Homework** assignments and **essays** must be done **on time**.
4.  Smartphones, tablets, computers, etc. must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
5.  **No eating** during class, but drinks **are allowed**.
6.  **Write** every chance you get **in your Writing Journals.**

**Grading Policy****:** The Business

Students’ term grades will be given based on their performances on the following aspects:

1.  Attendance + Participation: 10%
2.  Prewriting and Plan Homework: 10%
3.  TOEFL Mid-term essay: 10%
4.  Three long essays: 20% each (5-para, film criticism and argumentative)
5.  Autonomous Writing Journals: 10%
